channel.title: Shamu kills Trainer
channel.description:
http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/2010/02/25/2010-02-25_she_lived_her_dream_at_seaworld.html
It was her dream job, but Dawn Brancheau never thought it would cost her life.

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

As long as an animal knows you are dominant, it will listen. Dogs, Wolves, Tigers, they all listen to you as long as you are in control. Shaun Ellis was the alpha male of a pack of wolves, but after a short absence he was at the bottom of the pack.

You don’t tame an animal, it just acknowledges your superiority. Until you piss it off and it sees it’s opportunity. That’s nature.

Read full topic

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:18, topic:330792”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=427163.msg3138395#msg3138395 date=1267260671]

I dont know much about wild life but I’m pretty sure you are able to tame animals? Maybe people could teach sharks what to eat and what not to eat. May take some time but if it works they breed the sharks and hope for a result.

Sharks aren’t some giant threat that’s going to wipe out mankind, sharks kill less than 20 people a year and most deaths are accidental.
They aren’t hunting us, they just don’t realize what’s in the water so they bite it to taste it and figure it out.

They’re curious to know what it is? so they go thrashing and chomping at it?
[/quote]
Use your brain. Their anatomy is nothing like ours; no hands, no legs. Even a dog has the ability to identify something without biting. Sharks and many other creatures that live in the water don’t – they have fins, which are mostly static and certainly of no use in doing what a human’s hands can do.[/quote]

And then they see us and get jealous. That’s why they bite.

Read full topic

Sharks aren’t some giant threat that’s going to wipe out mankind, sharks kill less than 20 people a year and most deaths are accidental.
They aren’t hunting us, they just don’t realize what’s in the water so they bite it to taste it and figure it out.
[/quote]
They’re curious to know what it is? so they go thrashing and chomping at it?[/quote]
Use your brain. Their anatomy is nothing like ours; no hands, no legs. Even a dog has the ability to identify something without biting. Sharks and many other creatures that live in the water don’t – they have fins, which are mostly static and certainly of no use in doing what a human’s hands can do.

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

[quote=“c|p, post:11, topic:330792”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=427163.msg3137564#msg3137564 date=1267171919]

I hate to say it but I think this whale should be let go. Its been in at least 3 deaths now.

You shouldn’t hate to say that. It’s not right to keep whales in small tanks to exploit them for money. That is debatable though.

Its not about keeping them in small tanks or to entertain people, its to keep them away from predators and save there species. That’s my opinion.

But overall I do think the only type of fish that should be kept in tanks are Sharks.
[/quote]

Why should sharks be kept in tanks? It is not as if removing a few sharks from the ocean will make them less dangerous, not to mention they are a crucial part of the food web.[/quote]
I dont know much about wild life but I’m pretty sure you are able to tame animals? Maybe people could teach sharks what to eat and what not to eat. May take some time but if it works they breed the sharks and hope for a result.

Read full topic

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Killer wales kill big ass seals in the middle of the ocean, so when you put it in a tank that is only maybe 50 times the size of it’s body and have someone play with it wtf is expected. Of course you could side with the fact that it has been trained under such circumstances that it wasn’t expected, you shouldn’t fuck with something that has mean ass teeth and has death in it’s name.

I also just found out that Dawn Brancheau (the diver) grew up in my home town.

Read full topic

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Keep in mind this whale has killed other people as well.
Supposedly the whale was mad from an early incident, pulled her hair and drowned her.

@rip rsc, there’s nothing wrong with Sea Shepard. What Japan is doing is illegal and it’s good someone is attempting to stop them.

Read full topic

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You must be stupid to play with a Killer whale. Derp da Derp.

These animals belong in the wild. The idea that it saves it’s species by putting it in a tank is a great example of our fucked up society. Of course, I go to these kinds of parks. I love these animals. But I’d rather see them in their natural habitat. You can put these animals in a tank, or you can prevent assholes from killing them. Clean the ocean. Stop fishing with a net the size of my country. And stop with harpooning them for ‘research’.

But I must say that people like those of Sea Shepherd are annoying fucks that enjoy sniffing their own farts.

Read full topic

item.title: Shamu kills Trainer
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:10, topic:330792”][quote author=jme link=topic=427163.msg3137539#msg3137539 date=1267164893]

I hate to say it but I think this whale should be let go. Its been in at least 3 deaths now.

You shouldn’t hate to say that. It’s not right to keep whales in small tanks to exploit them for money. That is debatable though.
[/quote]
Its not about keeping them in small tanks or to entertain people, its to keep them away from predators and save there species. That’s my opinion.

But overall I do think the only type of fish that should be kept in tanks are Sharks.[/quote]

How do you justify that? How does keeping an animal in captivity save its species? In the Shamu whales’ (Shamu is the name of the show, several whales have been used) case, they don’t mate (at least, not ideally/how they would normally). I would consider leaving an animal in the wild rather than in captivity (regardless of them being able to reproduce) a far better way of ‘saving’ its species.

Why should sharks be kept in tanks? It is not as if removing a few sharks from the ocean will make them less dangerous, not to mention they are a crucial part of the food web.

Why should this whale be killed/let go? It is essentially torture to capture an animal, exploit it for your own monetary gain, and then blame it for killing its (potential) oppressors. What would happen to the whale if it was let go? Consider if it was born/raised entirely in captivity, what would it do? Either route is bad from this perspective, but it would not be a problem in the first place if people were not so fascinated by a ‘lesser’ species kept in a tank, and if the people with the tank weren’t so obsessed with hoarding cash.

Look at all these glorious, majestic whales. Aren’t they just magnificent?

Read full topic
